text: @iKannan Am glad that you shared your view.
@iKannan Its been a great struggle to achieve what you have seen on screen. But with your kind words it all seems to be worth it. Good day.

@pudiharicharan I could see news on 'Orey nyabagam' splashed everywhere. Thank you once again Haricharan.
@iKannan Thanks. I am certainly going to pass on your wishes to my entire team who would be delighted to know your feedback.

@srkathiir Our entire team feels elated to know your feedback. Thank you.
@srkathiir @srkathiir Our intention was to keep it simple
column4: just like first love and that's why I think people are able to connect to it.

text: @srkathiir Thank you so much for your kind words.
@quasiwritist Thank you. It is slated for a year-end release while music will release in September.
@ShankarTucker Shankar we missed you during the projection in Big screen. It was fabulous in 48FPS HDR projection. You would have loved it.
@ShankarTucker I know shankar...Bokeh is your first love ;-)
@ShankarTucker 's music is the magical ingredient of 'Orey Nyabagam' :-).
@onlynikil Thanks for posting our link sir.
@cinedreamer I am glad to know that you were able to connect to it.
@cinedreamer Through 48FPS HFR we can see life like imagery which is more crisp and HAS less motion blur compared to normal 24 FPS.
@nandhini_js Thank you...Wishing you the same for KNK.
@itisprashanth Thank you Prashanth. Glad that you liked it.
@srkathiir :-) I am sure it will be worth the wait.
@kumarbhar Thank you.Yes it is playing with Singham 2 in Sathyam and Santham screens. Please watch it in big screen and share your views.
@_IamPrasanna We are using Avid Media composer.
@_IamPrasanna We have used Red Epic camera and we have used frames from the film for the posters.
@_IamPrasanna Thanks. We have worked hard  to make it look unique. Let us know your feedback.
@kumarbhar Thanks Bharath. Looking forward for your feedback.
@avinash_r_k We are working towards it and I will be able to give a clear answer by tomorrow.
@malharhussain HFR is the future and we wanted to try it. The imagery is sharp and the movement is smoother without motion blur.
@malharhussain @itisprashanth Yes I have watched The Hobbit in 3d HFR. I liked it for the life like imagery and less eye strain factor.
@itisprashanth More credit should go to @gopalbalaji @qubecinema @SPIcinemas who made this possible.
@anbesivambala I will be able to give a clear answer tomorrow.
